venue.name: Harvard Center for Government and International Studies

item.description:
Human Rights Distinguished Lecture Series

“The Legacy of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights”
with
Justice Richard Goldstone
of the
Constitutional Court of South Africa

This is the first of a year-long series of lectures bringing cutting edge human rights scholarship and advocacy to Harvard University

Moderated by: Professor Nancy L. Rosenblum,
Chair of the Department of Government, Senator Joseph S. Clark Professor of Ethics in Politics and Government

Wednesday, November 5, 2008
6:00 – 7:30 pm

Tsai Auditorium
Harvard Center for Government and International Studies
1730 Cambridge Street

This event is sponsored by
The University Committee on Human Rights Studies
with support from
The Office of Undergraduate Education
Harvard College

This event is free and open to the public. Please feel free to forward it to others who might be interested.
item.how_to_find_us: I will not be there. If you recognize someone from the group, please say hello.
item.name: Human Rights
